title: In an Era of Deep Polarization, Unity Is Not Trump’s Mission
summary: President Trump does not subscribe to the traditional notion of being president for all Americans.

title: Kirk Shooting Suspect Held ‘Leftist Ideology,’ Utah Governor Says
summary: Gov. Spencer Cox said the suspect had been “radicalized,” and noted he had a romantic partner who is transitioning from male to female who is cooperating fully with investigators.

title: Russia Made Drone Production a Supreme Priority. Now It Swarms the Skies.
summary: Ukraine is struggling to defend itself against the growing number of attack drones that Moscow has started using in its onslaughts.

title: Romania Says Russian Drone Entered Its Airspace
summary: It was the second time in less than a week that a Russian drone had flown through a NATO member’s airspace. Last week, NATO scrambled fighter jets to shoot down Russian drones in Polish airspace.

title: Trump’s Reversals on Immigration Mount Over Economic Concerns
summary: President Trump has walked back some significant immigration policies that collide with his economic agenda, angering his far-right allies.

title: U.S. and China Resume Talks on Tariffs and TikTok
summary: Economic officials meeting in Madrid are seeking to head off a November tariff deadline.

title: Arriving in Israel, Rubio Meets Netanyahu at Jerusalem’s Western Wall
summary: The secretary of state is visiting Israel to consult with officials on security issues including the war in Gaza, which is testing relations with the United States.

title: Arab Ministers Meet on Response to Israeli Attack in Qatar
summary: Arab foreign ministers gathered on Sunday in the Qatari capital, Doha, to lay the groundwork for a summit there the next day.

title: The Insult Comic Who Sells Million-Dollar Homes
summary: In minute-long video tours of Florida real estate, Breanna Banaciski lampoons the rich — and the upscale houses she wants you to buy.

title: Dementia Is Stealing the Imagination of Robert Munsch, Children’s Book Writer
summary: Robert Munsch wrote “The Paper Bag Princess,” “Love You Forever” and other classics by performing them over and over for kids. But dementia is now stealing his imagination.

title: Inside a ‘Hell on Earth’ in Oklahoma
summary: The Greer Center was supposed to be a refuge for people with developmental disabilities. But accounts from inside the secretive facility paint a starkly different picture, depicting a place where helpless patients faced beatings, waterboarding and constant fear.

title: Inside the Golden State Valkyries, the Most Valuable Team in Women’s Sports
summary: Expectations were low for the Golden State Valkyries, the W.N.B.A.’s first expansion team in 17 years, but they captivated Bay Area sports fans and surprised the league by securing a playoff spot in their first season.

title: How Nancy Pelosi Quietly Shaped California’s Redistricting Fight
summary: Private meetings and longtime loyalties helped push what began as something of a Democratic bluff into a full-fledged counteroffensive against President Trump.

title: Lina Khan Revamped Antitrust. Now She’s Pushing the Democratic Party.
summary: The youngest chair in the history of the Federal Trade Commission is campaigning for Zohran Mamdani and defending her brand of populism.

title: McCaul, a Foreign Policy Leader in the House, Won’t Seek Re-election
summary: Representative Michael McCaul, an 11-term Texas Republican who chairs the House Foreign Affairs Committee, announced on Sunday that he would retire from Congress.

title: On the Supreme Court’s Emergency Docket, Sharp Partisan Divides
summary: The second Trump administration has filed roughly the same number of applications so far as the Biden administration did over four years. But they have fared quite differently.

title: Finding God in the App Store
summary: Millions of people are turning to chatbots to confess their darkest secrets and seek guidance from on high. “Is this actually God I am talking to?”

title: Introducing: Believing, Our Newsletter on Religion and Spirituality
summary: Each week, we’ll be covering how faith shapes our politics, culture and society — and how it’s appearing in new forms.

title: What to Expect at the 2025 Emmy Awards
summary: The Apple TV+ series “Severance” and the HBO Max medical show “The Pitt” are in a tight race for best drama, television’s most coveted prize.

title: The Daily’s Sunday Special: TV’s Big Night
summary: 6 Emmy-nominated shows we’re still thinking about.

title: There Are Monsters in Your Midst, Too
summary: No matter the direction of the tragedy, the end result is the same — the right grows angrier at the left, and the left grows angrier at the right.

title: Charlie Kirk’s Killing and Our Poisonous Internet
summary: We’ve fully stepped into a different historical moment: the age of brain-poisoning meme politics.

title: People Are Seeking God in Chatbots
summary: They’re confessing their secrets — and searching for something omniscient. Plus, we’re launching Believing, a new newsletter on modern religion and spirituality.

title: After Bolsonaro’s Conviction, Brazil Already Considers His Amnesty
summary: Brazil’s top court sentenced former President Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison. The nation’s Congress is already debating how to free him.

title: Ricky Hatton, British Boxer and Former World Champion, Is Dead
summary: The British authorities said that the boxer, who retired in 2012, was found unresponsive at a home in Greater Manchester.

title: Zoom’s Boom Days Are Over. What Comes Next?
summary: Eric Yuan, who saw the firm he founded become a household name during the pandemic, is trying to change the way people use the platform.
